name: flax husks to generic market for energy feed | energy feed, gross | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/19771/documentation

This is a linking (transfering) activity which links flax husks, to the generic market for energy feed. Flax husks are a by-product of the flax fibre production.

The activity starts with the reception of flax husks.

The activity models the part of flax husks which contributes to the generic market for energy feed, resulting in energy and protein outputs.
category: C:Manufacturing/10:Manufacture of food products/108:Manufacture of prepared animal feeds/1080:Manufacture of prepared animal feeds

exchanges.description: Calculated based on literature value for "hominy feed" (Feedipedia, 2015), which reports a crude protein content of 15.2% of dry matter; while gross energy content equates to 18.7 MJ/kg dry matter of fed. Dry matter content equates 89.3% of fed. Reference(s): Feedipedia (2015) Hominy Feed, Animal Feed Resources Information System, Available at: https://www.feedipedia.org/node/12290 (Accessed November 2017).
